intro: Rubus porteri, commonly known as the Mexican blackberry, is a species of bramble native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark red to black in color. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained, loamy soils. Rubus porteri is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along streambanks.
